interval.description: How long to wait before polling the source API for new tracks (in seconds)

maxInterval.description: When there has been no new activity from the Source API multi-scrobbler will gradually increase the wait time between polling up to this value (in seconds)

maxPollRetries.description: default # of automatic polling restarts on error

maxRequestRetries.description: default # of http request retries a source can make before error is thrown

retryMultiplier.description: default retry delay multiplier (retry attempt * multiplier = # of seconds to wait before retrying)

clients.description: Restrict scrobbling tracks played from this source to Clients with names from this list. If list is empty is not present Source scrobbles to all configured Clients.

maxRequestRetries.description: default # of http request retries a client can make before error is thrown.

checkExistingScrobbles.description: Check client for an existing scrobble at the same recorded time as the "new" track to be scrobbled. If an existing scrobble is found this track is not track scrobbled.

refreshEnabled.description: Try to get fresh scrobble history from client when tracks to be scrobbled are newer than the last scrobble found in client history

verbose.description: Options used for increasing verbosity of logging in MS (used for debugging)

retryMultiplier.description: default retry delay multiplier (retry attempt * multiplier = # of seconds to wait before retrying).

interval.description: optional, how long to wait before calling spotify for new tracks (in seconds)

maxPollRetries.description: default # of automatic polling restarts on error

maxRequestRetries.description: default # of http request retries a source can make before error is thrown

redirectUri.description: deezer redirect URI -- required only if not the default shown here. URI must end in "callback"

retryMultiplier.description: default retry delay multiplier (retry attempt * multiplier = # of seconds to wait before retrying)

clients.description: Restrict scrobbling tracks played from this source to Clients with names from this list. If list is empty is not present Source scrobbles to all configured Clients.

name.description: A friendly name used to identify webhook config in logs

priorities.description:
Priority of messages

* Info -> 5
* Warn -> 7
* Error -> 10

token.description: The token created for this Application in Gotify

type.description:
Webhook type. Valid values are:

* gotify
* ntfy

url.description: The URL of the Gotify server. Same URL that would be used to reach the Gotify UI

maxPollRetries.description: default # of automatic polling restarts on error

maxRequestRetries.description: default # of http request retries a source can make before error is thrown

options.description: Additional options for jellyfin logging and tuning

logPayload.description: Log raw Jellyfin webhook payload to debug

retryMultiplier.description: default retry delay multiplier (retry attempt * multiplier = # of seconds to wait before retrying)

servers.description:
optional list of servers to scrobble tracks from

If none are provided tracks from all servers will be scrobbled

users.description:
optional list of users to scrobble tracks from

If none are provided tracks from all users will be scrobbled

clients.description: Restrict scrobbling tracks played from this source to Clients with names from this list. If list is empty is not present Source scrobbles to all configured Clients.
Restrict scrobbling tracks played from this source to Clients with names from this list. If list is empty is not present Source scrobbles to all configured Clients.

configureAs.description: When used in `lastfm.config` this tells multi-scrobbler whether to use this data to configure a source or client.

apiKey.description: API Key generated from Last.fm account

maxPollRetries.description: default # of automatic polling restarts on error

maxRequestRetries.description: default # of http request retries a source can make before error is thrown

redirectUri.description: Optional URI to use for callback. Specify this if callback should be different than the default. MUST have "lastfm/callback" in the URL somewhere.

retryMultiplier.description: default retry delay multiplier (retry attempt * multiplier = # of seconds to wait before retrying)

session.description: Optional session id returned from a completed auth flow

configureAs.description: Should always be `client` when using LastFM as a client

data.description: Specific data required to configure this client

name.description: Unique identifier for this client. Used with sources to restrict where scrobbles are sent.

apiKey.description: API Key generated from Last.fm account

maxRequestRetries.description: default # of http request retries a source can make before error is thrown

redirectUri.description: Optional URI to use for callback. Specify this if callback should be different than the default. MUST have "lastfm/callback" in the URL somewhere.

retryMultiplier.description: default retry delay multiplier (retry attempt * multiplier = # of seconds to wait before retrying)

session.description: Optional session id returned from a completed auth flow

console.description: Specify the minimum log level streamed to the console (or docker container)

file.description: Specify the minimum log level to output to rotating files. If `false` no log files will be created.

level.description:
Specify the minimum log level for all log outputs without their own level specified.

Defaults to env `LOG_LEVEL` or `info` if not specified.

stream.description: Specify the minimum log level streamed to the UI

blacklist.description: DO NOT scrobble from any players that START WITH these values, case-insensitive

maxPollRetries.description: default # of automatic polling restarts on error

maxRequestRetries.description: default # of http request retries a source can make before error is thrown

retryMultiplier.description: default retry delay multiplier (retry attempt * multiplier = # of seconds to wait before retrying)

whitelist.description:
ONLY from any players that START WITH these values, case-insensitive

If whitelist is present then blacklist is ignored

clients.description: Restrict scrobbling tracks played from this source to Clients with names from this list. If list is empty is not present Source scrobbles to all configured Clients.

data.description: Specific data required to configure this client

name.description: Unique identifier for this client. Used with sources to restrict where scrobbles are sent.

maxRequestRetries.description: default # of http request retries a source can make before error is thrown

checkExistingScrobbles.description: Check client for an existing scrobble at the same recorded time as the "new" track to be scrobbled. If an existing scrobble is found this track is not track scrobbled.

refreshEnabled.description: Try to get fresh scrobble history from client when tracks to be scrobbled are newer than the last scrobble found in client history

verbose.description: Options used for increasing verbosity of logging in MS (used for debugging)

retryMultiplier.description: default retry delay multiplier (retry attempt * multiplier = # of seconds to wait before retrying)

MatchLoggingOptions.description: Scrobble matching (between new source track and existing client scrobbles) logging options. Used for debugging.

confidenceBreakdown.description: Include confidence breakdowns in track match logging, if applicable

onMatch.description: Log to DEBUG when a new track DOES match an existing scrobble

onNoMatch.description: Log to DEBUG when a new track does NOT match an existing scrobble

albumBlacklist.description:
Remove album data that matches any case-insensitive string from this list when scrobbling,

For certain sources (Soundcloud) Mopidy does not have all track info (Album) and will instead use "Soundcloud" as the Album name. You can prevent multi-scrobbler from using this bad Album data by adding the fake name to this list. Multi-scrobbler will still scrobble the track, just without the bad data.

interval.description: How long to wait before polling the source API for new tracks (in seconds)

maxInterval.description: When there has been no new activity from the Source API multi-scrobbler will gradually increase the wait time between polling up to this value (in seconds)

maxPollRetries.description: default # of automatic polling restarts on error

maxRequestRetries.description: default # of http request retries a source can make before error is thrown

retryMultiplier.description: default retry delay multiplier (retry attempt * multiplier = # of seconds to wait before retrying)

uriBlacklist.description:
Do not scrobble tracks whose URI STARTS WITH any of these strings, case-insensitive

EX: Don't scrobble tracks from soundcloud by adding 'soundcloud' to this list.

List is ignored if uriWhitelist is used.

uriWhitelist.description:
Only scrobble tracks whose URI STARTS WITH any of these strings, case-insensitive

EX: Only scrobble tracks from soundcloud by adding 'soundcloud' to this list.

url.description:
URL of the Mopidy HTTP server to connect to

You MUST have Mopidy-HTTP extension enabled: https://mopidy.com/ext/http

multi-scrobbler connects to the WebSocket endpoint that ultimately looks like this => `ws://localhost:6680/mopidy/ws/`

The URL you provide here will have all parts not explicitly defined filled in for you so if these are not the default you must define them.

Parts => [default value]

* Protocol => `ws://`
* Hostname => `localhost`
* Port => `6680`
* Path => `/mopidy/ws/`

interval.description:
How long to wait before polling the source API for new tracks (in seconds)

It is unlikely you should need to change this unless you scrobble many very short tracks often

Reading:
* https://developer.spotify.com/documentation/web-api/guides/rate-limits/
* https://medium.com/mendix/limiting-your-amount-of-calls-in-mendix-most-of-the-time-rest-835dde55b10e
  * The rate limit is ~180 req/min
